data.title: NewsBreak Alexander County, NC
data.meta_description: NewsBreak provides latest and breaking Alexander County, NC local news, weather forecast, crime and safety reports, traffic updates, event notices, sports, entertainment, local life and other items of interest in the community.
data.text:
A Newton woman has been sentenced in an impaired driving case from 2022 in which her vehicle struck another car, resulting in a man’s death. In Alexander County Superior Court during the August 12 term, Cierra Lashay Jones pleaded guilty to Felony Death by Vehicle, Driving While Impaired, and four counts of Felony Serious Injury and was sentenced by Judge Clifton Smith to 64-89 months, plus 16-29 months in prison.

A chicken house in Alexander County was destroyed by a fire Wednesday morning. Around 8 a.m., firefighters were still at the scene. The chicken house was located along Arthur Jenkins Lane off Sipe Road in the Ellendale community of Alexander County. Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts...

Is there high school football this week in Alexander County, North Carolina Of course. And we offer details on how to watch the games below. Don’t miss out on a single high school game. Sign up for an NFHS Network annual pass and get full access to live regular season and postseason sporting events and get 45% off compared to a monthly pass.

The Alexander County Sheriff’s Office has released information about an incident involving road rage and a shot being fired Wednesday morning. Alexander County 911 received a call at 9:34 am about shots fired in the parking lot of Taylorsville Savings Bank on Highway 90 in Hiddenite. Deputies learned that two men had entered the parking lot in separate vehicles. The two males became engaged in verbal confrontation. One of the male subjects pointed a handgun in the direction of the other male. At least one shot was fired, however it’s not certain if the shot was fired in the other man’s direction.

A man has entered a guilty plea in Alexander County Superior Court. Alexanderos Nikola Tsilianos, age 40 of Plumtree in Avery County, pleaded guilty to felony obstruction of justice and admitted to being an habitual felon. He was sentenced to 89 to 119 months, or seven years, five months to nine years, eleven months in prison.

Inez Maria Kim, 43 of Taylorsville, was taken into custody on Monday by the Alexander County Sheriff’s Office. She was served a warrant for probation violation, felony possession of methamphetamine and possession of drug paraphernalia. Kim was placed in the Alexander County Detention Center with bond listed at $5,000. September 3rd is listed as a court date.

A Hickory man has been arrested for the second time since May in Alexander County. On Tuesday, 34-year old Kyle Lewis Icard was detained and charged with probation violation He was jailed on the same charge in May. Icard is no longer listed in custody. Previous charges are pending against...

At about seven o’clock this morning (August 28), multiple fire departments were dispatched to a structure fire at 85 Arthur Jenkins Lane in Alexander County. The building was a former poultry operation. Assistant Fire Marshall Garrett Huffman said the building had not been occupied by chickens for approximately a year. He also said the fire was accidental and was likely electrical in nature.

40-year-old Alexanderos Nikola Tsilianos, who is listed online as a resident of Plumtree in Avery County, pleaded guilty to felony obstruction of justice and admitted to being an habitual felon. The plea was entered during a recent session of Alexander County Superior Court. He was sentenced to 89 to 119 months, or seven years, five months to nine years, eleven months in prison.

1889: Charles G Conn received a patent for the metal Clarinet. 1859: Petroleum is discovered in Titusville, Pennsylvania leading to the world’s first commercially successful oil well. 1921: The owner of Acme Packing Company in Green Bay, Wisconsin bought a pro football team. J.E. Clair paid tribute to those...

Kristi Waters Keever, age 44 of Taylorsville, was arrested by the Alexander County Sheriff’s Office on Friday, August 23rd. She was served a warrant from Catawba County for felony probation violation. Keever has pending charges in Catawba County for felony possession of methamphetamine, felony possession of schedule II controlled substance and possession of drug paraphernalia. A $20,000 secured bond was set for Keever and of earlier today, she remained in the Alexander County Jail.

Rodney Dean Matlock, age 53 of Hiddenite, was arrested Monday by the Alexander County Sheriff’s Office. He’s charged with felony possession of schedule II controlled substance, felony maintaining a vehicle /dwelling/place for controlled substance and possession of drug paraphernalia. Matlock has been released under a secured bond of $10,000.

Having qualified as Executor of the estate of Damon K. Baker, deceased, late of Alexander County, North Carolina, this is to notify all persons having claims against said estate to present them to the undersigned on or before the 20th day of November, 2024, or this notice will be pleaded in bar of their recovery. Anyone indebted to same will please make immediate settlement.

Robert John Britting, age 39 of Hiddenite, was arrested on Sunday by the Alexander County Sheriff’s Office. He is charged with attempted breaking and entering. Bond has been set at $25,000 and Britting remains in custody. An appearance is scheduled for today in District Court.

A Conover man is in Alexander County custody following a vehicle chase over the weekend. Saturday evening, 36-year old Scotty Allen Harrington was arrested after attempting to avoid a checkpoint conducted by the Highway Patrol and the Sheriff’s Office in Southern Alexander County. Harrington fled on a motorcycle at a high rate of speed into Catawba County where he crashed. After crashing, Harrington attempted to flee on foot but was captured. He was found to be in possession of a significant amount of illegal substances.

36-year old Scotty Allen Harrington of Conover was arrested in Alexander County Saturday evening (August 24) on charges that include felony counts of trafficking in methamphetamine, possession with intent to manufacture, sell, or deliver meth, and fleeing to elude arrest with a motor vehicle. He was also charged with possession of stolen goods (license tag), driving while license revoked, and multiple counts of resisting a public officer.
